titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6) to extend the authorization of programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-499, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 6 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substituted recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce now printed in the bill, modified by the amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution, as an origianl bill for the purpose of amendment. It shall be in order to consider the amendment printed in part 2 of this report befor consideration of any other amendment, debatable for 20 minutes.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 171.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/28/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified open) for the consideration of H.R. 6 (higher education programs).
